text: Hi all, I'm trying to add a search form to a blog template but can't seem to find much documentation aside from Google site search. Can anyone point me in the right direction?

i'm about to add a www. subdomain to a portal that already has other subdomains with the same root domain... i'm assuming SSL will rollover instantly since this is the case... can anybody confirm/deny my thoughts here?
that email verification route never works...
It is pretty instant, but these aren't wild card domains. Each one has its own ssl

Hi Sam, here is some information regarding our built in site search:
• <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/features/content-search>
• <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/default-modules#site-search-input>
• <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/default-modules#search-results>
I had a question I was wondering if I built coded modules before buying the cms would they be able to transfer smoothly onto the cms without any extra changes that need to be made?

Hey Mohammed, you definitely could using a developer sandbox and the CMS CLI:

<https://offers.HubSpot.com/free-cms-developer-sandbox>

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cms-cli>
Awesome really appreciate it! Would I also be able to use the market modules design templates (modules) for practice?

Hi. For my HubSpot site I want to edit the HTML of a form. I made a form with the form on the CMS. It works but seems to be getting overridden by another global style. Editing that global style edits another global style in the footer and I cant seem to see the raw html otherwise I would add a class or ID to fix the problem. Help?
Why don't you override the class in the header of the HTML so its only locally being changed.
